Event.0: American church leader Fred Phelps—who founded (1955) the Westboro Baptist Church, which became known for its strident opposition to homosexuality and the gay rights movement, as expressed on picket signs carried by church members at funerals and other events—died in Topeka, Kansas.
Event.1: English writer Sir Arthur C. Clarke—who was best known for his visionary science-fiction novels and for his work on Stanley Kubrick's hugely successful motion picture 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)—died in Sri Lanka.
Event.2: Airstrikes by an American and British-led coalition signal the beginning of the invasion of Iraq, without United Nations support and in defiance of world opinion
Event.3:
Iraq War begins
On this day in 2003, U.S. President George W. Bush ordered air strikes on Baghdad, thus launching the Iraq War to oust dictator Saddam Hussein, who was believed (wrongly) to be manufacturing weapons of mass destruction.
Event.4: Dutch American artist Willem de Kooning, a major exponent of Abstract Expressionism and Action painting, whose series Woman I–VI caused a stir with its violent images and impulsive technique, died at the age of 92.
Event.5: Winnie Madikizela-Mandela divorces Nelson Mandela after 38 years of marrage
Event.6: One of the worst fires in the history of the Philippines swept through a Manila discotheque, killing 159 of the 400 people in the nightclub, which was intended to hold no more than 35.
Event.7: NFL owners strip Phoenix of 1993 Super Bowl game due to Arizona Not recognizing Martin Luther King Day
Event.8: American sitcom "Kate & Allie" premieres on CBS TV starring Susan Saint James and Jane Curtin
Event.9: Argentine forces mobilized after a dispute between Argentine workers and British scientists on British-controlled South Georgia island, leading to Argentina's invasion of the Falklands two weeks later.
Event.10: Princess Margaret separates from the Earl of Snowdon, after 16 years
Event.11: American musician Bob Dylan released his eponymous debut album to mixed reviews.
Event.12: Author Aldous Huxley (62) weds musician and author Laura Archera (45)
Event.13:
Bruce Willis
American actor
was born
Event.14:
Glenn Close
American actress
was born
Event.15: The Sydney Harbour Bridge is opened
Event.16: American poet e.e. (Edward Estlin) Cummings marries first wife Elaine Orr. The marriage lasts less than 9 months.
Event.17: US Senate rejects Treaty of Versailles for 2nd time refusing to ratify League of Nations' covenant (maintaining isolation policy)
Event.18: Józef Piłsudski was named marshal of Poland.
Event.19: Jazz musician Louis Armstrong (17) weds Daisy Parker (21)
Event.20: The first International Women's Day was observed.
Event.21:
Adolf Eichmann
German military official
was born
Event.22:
Albert Speer
German architect and Nazi official
was born
Event.23: Confederate cruiser SS Georgiana destroyed on her maiden voyage with a cargo of munitions, and medicines then valued over $1,000,000. Wreck discovered exactly 102 years later by teenage diver and pioneer underwater archaeologist E. Lee Spence.
Event.24:
William Jennings Bryan
American politician
was born
Event.25: William Jennings Bryan, a Democratic and Populist leader and a magnetic orator who ran unsuccessfully three times for the U.S. presidency (1896, 1900, 1908), was born.
Event.26: Opera "Faust" by Charles Gounod premieres in Paris
Event.27: 200 members of Peking imperial family and court commit suicide in loyalty to the Emperor
Event.28: In the Conspiracy of Amboise, French Huguenot aristocrats failed to overthrow the Roman Catholic house of Guise.
Event.29: Frederick III became the last Holy Roman emperor to be crowned by a pope, Nicholas V.
Event.30: A Mongolian victory at the naval Battle of Yamen ends the Song Dynasty in China
